The Comptroller General detected that officials from the Yarinacocha Amazon Hospital made calculations and authorizations of payments in favor of health personnel for hospital guards during 2019, but with amounts greater than what is established in current regulations; In addition, they omitted the application of discounts for non-compliance of guards, this caused an economic loss of S/ 81,641.62 to the State.

According to the Specific Control Report No. 015-2021-2-0836-SCE , it was evidenced that employees in the area of ??settlement of payments and assets, prepared settlements of hospital guards considering amounts higher than those indicated in the standard, and made settlements without the administrative approvals; however, they were included in the single payroll by the remuneration unit, making the disbursement with the authorization of the administration office.

Likewise, it was determined that compliance with the schedule of hospital shifts had not been reported and the corresponding discounts were not made for absences, since said service had been carried out at the discretion of the health personnel themselves, a situation that has been evidenced in the consolidation of staff markings, as well as the unique payment forms of 2019. Consequently, civil and administrative responsibility was identified in 2 former officials and 3 servers from the administration offices, personnel, and statistical control area of ??the Yarinacocha Amazonian Hospital.

This report was notified on December 30, 2021 to the executive director of the Amazon Hospital of Yarinacocha, for the demarcation of responsibilities of the officials, the Public Attorney of the Comptroller General of the Republic was also notified , to initiate legal actions. corresponding. Citizens can access the control reports issued by the Ucayali Regional Control Office , which are published in the Control Services Report Search Engine.
